content.question: Figure 1 shows the relative rates of transpiration (water loss) and water intake for a plant over an <math alttext="18" overflow="scroll"><mn>18</mn></math>-hour period. Which of the following describes the most likely relationship between transpiration and water intake in the plant?

choices.label: Transpiration from the leaves of the plant stimulates subsequent water intake by the roots of the plant.
Transpiration and water intake peak at the same time of day.
Water intake by the roots of the plant drives transpiration at the leaves of the plant.
Transpiration and water intake have an inverse relationship.

content.answer: Transpiration from the leaves of the plant stimulates subsequent water intake by the roots of the plant.
